unnormalised: **India Pushes for Solar Energy Adoption in Rural Areas**
normalised: **India Pushes for Solar Energy Adoption in Rural Areas**

unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 – A new initiative led by Dr. Anjali Sharma at IIT-Madras is focusing on promoting solar energy solutions in remote villages of Rajasthan. The project, funded by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE), aims to replace traditional wood-burning stoves with solar-powered cooking systems, significantly reducing indoor air pollution.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – A new initiative led by Doctor Anjali Sharma at I I T-Madras is focusing on promoting solar energy solutions in remote villages of Rajasthan. The project, funded by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (M N R E), aims to replace traditional wood-burning stoves with solar-powered cooking systems, significantly reducing indoor air pollution.

unnormalised: The initiative will also establish solar-powered microgrids to electrify households and small businesses, providing reliable electricity access where it is currently scarce. This move aligns with India's commitment to achieving its renewable energy targets under the Paris Agreement. Each household will receive subsidies of up to Rs. 10,000 to install rooftop solar panels.

unnormalised: Preliminary data shows that a 1000 sq ft solar panel installation can power an entire village, with surplus energy being sold back to the grid. The project plans to cover a radius of 50 km around Jodhpur in the initial phase, incorporating local artisan communities who will be trained to maintain the solar infrastructure.
